Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: William R. Weiss "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Yes some people will say that this TV is not loaded with features, like all the streaming internet blah-de-blah-blah-blah. But if you have that in your Blu-ray player, you don't need it in your TV as well. And some of us don't care about watching streaming movies over the net, some of us don't have good enough broadband connections where we live to support that anyway. And some of us BUY blu-ray movies that we like. So enough about internet bloody apps.The biggest complaint about this set offered by some is the fact that it only has 2 HDMI ports. And that could be a problem for some. But if you control all of your gear (like I do) through your A/V receiver, you only need ONE HDMI going into the TV anyway. If you've got to plug all of your high-def gear right into the TV, and you've got more than 2 HDMI devices, this TV is not for you, find another. So enough about only 2 HDMI ports.The picture quality of this TV is AMAZING. The total evenness of the backlight, especially during a pitch black scene, or when the background is totally black, is amazing. Total blackness with no uneven lighting at all...ANYWHERE on the screen, even edges and corners. I haven't seen a TV that can compare to this one in that respect.The set has MANY full manual picture controls and tweaks, and some advanced ones, or three pre-programed modes that you can still tweak. You don't have to settle for what the TV maker says is good, although Samsung's modes are pretty darn good, right out of the box. The "dynamic" mode is a little contrasty for my taste though. But still, it's easily modified.The front bezel on this TV is about as thin as they get on LCD/LED TVs. Some would say that this TV is a tad on the thick side depth-wise, considering it's an LED TV, but it's still pretty thin, compared to my 3 year old Sony 52" LCD, which was a tank.The sound is about the same as other thin LCD/LED TVs. You can't get huge speakers to fit into these things, let's face it. Thin with a small bezel means thin, small speakers. If you're listening through a surround sound system (as I and anyone with a "home theater system" do) it's not an issue.The remote control is a bit small, but its backlit buttons can light up in the dark, which is a plus.I just bought this TV in a bricks and mortar store for $1199, which I think is a steal. Two weeks ago I bought an LG 55" LCD and it's going back to the store today. This Samsung totally blows the LG away...the backlighting on the LG was so bad and uneven I couldn't stand it. It was really noticible how bad it was during dark scenes in movies like the second "Pirates of the Caribbean" movie, any of the "Batman" movies or "Aliens" those movies are chock full of very dark scenes. The LG couldn't handle them, but the Samsung does them proud...inky rich blacks that still have some detail in them.Someplace online I read in someone's comments that this TV doesn't do 24hz film mode. It most certainly does....set your Blu-ray player to that mode and then press the "info" button on this Samsung TV's remote and it will display that info on the screen. 24 bloody hz. So don't believe everything that people say in reviews. (except for mine lol)If you want a REALLY decent TV that doesn't have to wake you up, make you breakfast, Twitter and Facebook for you, do your laundry and surf the net for you, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is outstanding.  The LED technology really makes everything pop with its high contrast ratio.  It is just as good as the best plasmas that I have seen.  This set is also more energy efficient than plasmas with a $12 per year energy consumption for the 55" model.The black levels on this TV are fantastic and even across the entire screen from corner to corner. Samsung was able to achieve this by utilizing the full array LED technology.  The edge lit LED technology on other sets allows for a thinner TV, but in most cases the picture suffers from the flashlight effect where light shines up into the picture from the corners and edges of the screen.  Not on this TV.  It is truly amazing watching dark movies at night on this set.  White text on black background is like reading a high quality printed text.  Watching John Mayer in concert feels like I am in the audience.  Truly amazing.I am pleasantly surprised at how good the sound is.  The standard setting is set to mono, but there is a surround sound setting that simulates a 5.1 speaker system.  As soon as I enabled this, it filled up the room with great sound.  I am also in love with how thin Samsung was able to get the bezel on this TV.  It allowed me to purchase a larger TV for the room, as I saved space with the small bezel.  When the TV is turned off it looks slick.  The screen is a deep matte black that matches the bezel which also matches the sleek looking stand.Samsung was able to keep the cost lower on this TV as it is not a smart TV, only has 2 HDMI inputs and is 2D.  I did not need a smart TV (I use the Apple TV to transmit movie purchases from the App store and YouTube onto the screen), I do not play games (PS2, Nintendo) and so the 2 HDMI inputs work out fine for me.  I also am more of a traditionalist and did not want to buy into 3D technology on a TV while it is still in its infancy stage.Also, I must add that the standard brightness setting out the box was a little bright.  I had to turn this down and I also set the picture to "movie" mode with great results.  Of course this is personal taste.  There are many picture settings that you can play around with in order to get the picture to that sweet spot.I have had this TV for a couple of weeks now and as you can tell I am still excited about it.  Overall you just cannot go wrong.  Worth every penny paid.

Reviews.Title: STOP!  Don't Call Samsung!
Reviews.Author: John Keitz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for my 10 year old Mitsubishi RPTV.  After a lot of research, this looked like the right fit for the price.  It arrived in a pristine box, and the shippers carefully set it down in the living room (I was waiting for the accompanying furniture to arrive), where it sat undisturbed for three days.  When the time came, we opened the box, connected the HDMI cable to the surround sound receiver, and turned on the TV.  To my shock, 3/4 of the screen was black.  There was a clear picture on the right side of the screen.  In the box was a paper that said "STOP: If your TV isn't working properly, do not return it to the store, call this number ------," so I called.  The nice representative told me that it was covered by the warranty (of course), and that they would arrange for another company to send out a repair technician.  I wasn't particularly happy that my "new" TV was going to be a repair job, but I waited.  four days later, the repair company called me wanting to schedule an "estimate for out of warranty repair."  I hit the roof!  I said "what do you mean out of warranty, its barely out of box!?!"  Nevertheless, they told me to take it up with Samsung.  After nearly an hour of getting kicked from one representative to another, Samsung refused to honor their warranty.  In the end, the last Samsung person I spoke to suggested that I "try to return it to the store."  Incredulous, I asked "if that's the case, why do you put a paper in there telling me NOT to return it to the store?"At that point, I called Amazon, and the helpful representative arranged for the return in less than fifteen minutes.  He also helped me select another non-Samsung model (I sprung for the Sony, and boy I'm glad I did!).  I am fortunate that Amazon is a reputable company, unlike Samsung.I will never buy another Samsung anything!  On the other hand, while I already did most of my shopping at Amazon, I will be trying to make all of my purchases there from now on.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: tbone
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I've always read about sets having rich, dark blacks and didn't think much about it because they all seemed pretty similar. The same went for LED. But that changed with this TV as I could see the difference the first time I turned it on. It can maintain the rich blacks even when other settings are at bright levels. The contrast ratio is outstanding as the range from deep blacks to bright colors produce a beautiful and vivid picture. I bought this set primarily for sports, and motion blur has never been an issue.The sound for a HDTV is very good. I know most people will use a home stereo system but there are lots of times when I don't need it. It has great volume and clarity for basic programming after you make some adjustments in the Audio menu.Samsung is using a full array back light in this model line to replace their old CCFL panels. However, to keep the cost at a mid level price, they don't use as many LED's as in their pricier sets. I did notice two things that are more than likely a result of this.1) Each corner of the panel had a small and very feint shadow that extends about an inch into the screen that is only noticeable against light backgrounds. On the good side, I've had the set for about six weeks and the shadows have gone away in two corners and appear to be getting better in the others so this may be a break in issue.2) There is about a 2" inch band around the exterior border of the panel that is just a bit lighter than the rest of the screen. I can only see it against a light background when the camera is panning across the screen. Otherwise I never notice it. At first I only saw it on the right and left sides but then I saw a shot of a light gray overcast sky that filled the entire panel. At that time I could see the outline of the "light band" that framed the exterior portion of all four side.I'm guessing the "light band" is the border of the full array back light. The good thing is it is very minor and I don't even notice it anymore, nor do I feel it detracts from the picture. Unlike the corner shadows, I don't think it has anything to do with break in. I would guess many people have sets with the same thing and they don't notice it. In fact, my wife had a hard time noticing even after I pointed it out to her.Before buying this TV, I tried 55" models from Vizio, LG, and Sharp. The larger the panel the more chance there will be flaw and I ended up returning all of them. At this point I think HDTV quality control is like the lottery, even with the same models. You hope you get a good set but none of them are perfect. This one is pretty close for me and I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Excellente! 55 inches of awesome.  Want Smart TV?, get Roku2
Reviews.Author: Colin P. Saunders
Reviews.Content: Like many others have already said, this is a fantastic LED TV for the money.  It is a basic TV and does what a basic TV should do and that is, look amazing when you watch it.  We passed on the more expensive "smart" TV models Samsung had to offer however.  Maybe you are thinking, what is a smart TV anyway?  It is just a TV set that has a built in Internet connection and comes with built in software/applications which allow you to stream videos and watch them on the TV.  If you have ever seen streaming Netflix on a computer, it is the same idea.  Each TV brand (LG, Samsung, etc..) has their own version of smart TV software and applications.  I am sure all TV's in the future will eventually be "smart", but right now most people will tell you that the apps (aka: applications) and are really not quite there yet with multiple problems overall.  A quick Google search using the words "Samsung Smart TV's problems" came up with tons on people complaining about the "smart" part of their Samsung TV's.  The price difference between this "basic" model TV and a "smart" TV model, was too steep and we decided excellent picture was what we wanted, not a smart TV.  Instead, we paired this TV with a Roku 2 XS 1080p Streaming Player for $75 and couldn't be happier. Google/read the excellent reviews on the Roku 2 if you need more info, but essentially is an external version of a "smart" TV, in a package the size of a hockey puck!Sound on this TV isn't that bad, all things considering.  Usually audio on big screen TV's is so poor, you end up having to buy a home theatre system right away.  I spent a lot of time playing with the audio features, working to make the voices/speaking parts of movies and Roku 2 content sound better, with moderate success.  However, this is more of a home theater/Dolby issue, than it is a problem with the TV or Samsung.  I am just not a fan of simulated "Surround Sound".  I will eventually move to a 5.1 Dolby home theater sound system and be done with it.  The center channel speaker is the key to clear voices in movies and Roku 2 content, in case you didn't already know that.  Otherwise, our Over The Air (OTA) TV channels sounded fine, thanks to our newly purchased Leaf Plus Amplified Indoor HDTV Antenna.I am not a gamer, so the two HMDI ports this model comes, was enough for us.  We use one with the Roku 2, the other is used by the Blu-Ray player (a regular blu-ray player, not a "smart" blu-ray player).  I will end up using the optical "audio out" jack on the TV to a receiver, once I go for the home theater sound system.  I thought the optical audio out was a nice touch by Samsung!Saw no odd colors, blacks are dark, the entire panel is back lit and have not seen any motion blur when watching fast moving sports.  I ended up turning off the Motion Plus and LED Plus, but it is there if we need it.TV is light and super thin.  Easy to set up and was great out of the box.Get this TV if what you want is an excellent picture, you don't care about "smart" and having two HMDI jacks isn't going to be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Entertainment
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Samsung TV after my 36" Panasonic had a lightning surge that zapped it. I decided I did not need the Smart tv and 3D features with more expensive Samsung models. I can use my Samsung bluray to get the online apps offered. The most important feature is the picture quality and this model passes with flying colors. The tv has plenty of picture adjustments that you can fine tune to your desire. I watch mosty sports on it and the hockey is just outstanding to watch. The 2 HDMI ports are no problem which I use the Charter cable box and my blue ray.  I can always unplug the blue ray to connect another device if needed. So far I'm very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Setting up PC/HDMI has 1 hidden step
Reviews.Author: ComputerGuyNJ
Reviews.Content: When setting up the PC for HDMI, there's a hidden step that's not very obvious, nor required by other brands of TVs:If you don't do this, the TV will only display in 1650x1050, not 1920x1080. This will cut off the start bar.Your PC must be hooked up to HDMI port 1.Turn on the PC, set the resolution to 1920x1080.On the remote:Hit [Source]Hit [Tools]Hit [Enter]Hit [Right Arrow Key]Select "PC" option.Hit [Return] 3 timesThis will fix the image size.Source: PDF of the Manual from Samsung.com, [...]

Reviews.Title: Samsung  55EH6000
Reviews.Author: BobbyAzul
Reviews.Content: Great TV for those wanting a superior picture in a 55-inch product without all the bells and whistles.  LED Picture truly is remarkable for a TV that uses much less energy than plasma or LCD models.Biggest complaints are only 2 HDMI ports, and a lower quality stand that causes the TV to tilt forward a bit. For what the TV costs, stand should be higher quality.  Samsung may be assuming that anyone who buys this TV will mount it on a wall - but I needed the TV to fit into a built-in entertainment center.  It does fit perfectly, but has a natural tilt.  Still, I would highly recommend this TV for its picture quality.  Amazing!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Manny V
Reviews.Content: I can not imagine what TV would be better than this one. Outstanding picture and great sound quality. We are just blown away on how clear the picture is! Also with Amazon, I was  concerned making such a big purchase on line. Amazon had great communication with me on the delivery. The delivery service was very good. They worked with me on a time that fit with my schedule for delivey and assembly.

Reviews.Title: Decent Picture Quality and Sound, but a little pricey.
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: After a good few weeks with this TV I decided to return it and try something else. It's not that it wasn't a "bad" TV necessarily, but it's just not great especially considering the price and other TV's in the same price range.Pros- Sound: It's actually pretty great. Turn on the "surround sound" effect, leave the sound on standard and bring down the bass a little, and you're set. I was really impressed with this actually. I could "feel" explosions and deep bass.- Backlit LED: Unlike other "edge-lit" LED's, this TV is backlit. What this mean is you're not likely to experience a "clouding" effect or light on the edge of the tv during a dark scene. I didn't experience any other these negative effects. I prefer this type of lighting but it does mean that it's not going to be as thin as edge-lit TV's. That's ok though as I didn't have it mounted on the wall. If you plan on mounting your TV this is probably not the one for you.- 120 Hz processing: Samsung does incorporate their 120Hz processing well. This is what other people say gives a "soap opera" effect on TVs and just turn off. But actually it's a great thing especially if you like action movies and playing video games. It's basically doubling the framerate of what you currently are watching, inserting frames in-between the source to make the transition from frame to frame smoother. Playing Skyrim on Xbox360 with 120 Hz processing on means it looks like a 60 FPS (frames per second) video game, when actually it's a standard 30. I think a lot of people overlook this feature, but it's great if you're a gamer.-No power light on the front: A lot of HDTV's have a power light on the front. Horrible and distracting! Would you like it if you went to a movie theater and there was a lightbulb on under the screen? There is nothing of the such on this Samsung.Cons- Inputs: Only 2 HDMI inputs. Yikes! If you have 3 devices, you'll either have to switch a device to component or use an HDMI splitter. At this current price an HDTV should have at least 3 HDMI inputs, probably should have 4 though.- Picture Quality: It's ok. Not GREAT considering the price, but ok. You will DEFINITELY have to mess with the settings though. All of the default picture settings have picture settings that wash out the details. I recommend getting a calibration Blu Ray. I used the Disney World of Wonder. I feel like the picture quality is decent, better than a cheap tv, but for this price, it's lacking. Bright blacks and washed out color scheme bring it down. I could not for the life of me adjust the color perfectly. I have the cheap TCL 40" and using a calibration disk was able to adjust the color perfectly. Not so with the Samsung.- Calibration features: When calibrating this TV, a lot of the menu takes up the screen, making it hard to compare the native image. So you'll have to make an adjustment and exit completely out of the menu to see if you're adjustment is good or not. Makes calibrating very tedious.- TV Stand: Besides being a dust magnet, the Stand makes the TV tilt forward more than 5 degrees. Very strange, I tried taking it off and re-screwing in, but couldn't get it perpendicular. Just the way it's built. It's not a big deal.... but at this price it is. If I'm paying this much for a TV I want it to look good. When I walk by it from the side it's disorienting to see you're TV tilting forward.- Remote: The remote is "lighted", which is nice... but not really. In complete darkness it's still hard to see all of the buttons you need. Not a very bright light. On top of that the remote is too responsive. I was constantly going past the menu I needed because I pushed down once but the TV read it as 2 times I pushed it. (UPDATE - 7/15/12) Another user posted saying he had the same problem but you can fix it by sliding the stand in properly then screwing in the screws. I thought I did this, and if I had the TV I'd try it but I've already returned it and am looking at getting the es6500. If you are having this problem try taking the stand off and putting it on again all the way. I guess I didn't. At least I know I'm not the only one I know others have had this issue and thought it was not fixable.I would only recommend this model if it drops in price considerably. And at that, only purchase if you need 2 devices hooked up. Any more and you'll have to get an HDMI splitter. Something you really shouldn't have to do in this day and age. Otherwise, there are a lot of TVs with equal or better picture quality and more features in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: Superior Value
Reviews.Author: Ethics in Review "That's one opinion."
Reviews.Content: My $3300 5 year old LCD died and I was not going to spend that kind of money on a TV again. It's picture quality was fantastic and without jitter and few artifacts. This Samsung is equal if not better! I just needed 2 HDMI ports as my TiVo and Blue Ray disk already have the 'SMART' options so why spend an additional $300 to $400 for options I will never use?  I was having a difficult time getting the Samsung not to look like a "diorama with distinct foreground and background" (C. Koehler's description) that makes the scene pronounced. I was about to return the TV for a plasma set until I read the review on the Samsung 40" UN40EH6000 by C. Koehler dated January 16, 2013. For my tastes, Koehler's configuration is spot on and now I have a TV that exceeds my expectations for price and picture quality. I will take the liberty to repeat Koehler's configuration below. The only thing I changed was to set the Black Tone to Dark (not Darkest) in order to see a little more detail. I highly recommend this Samsung as a great buy (I got it for $799).C. Koehler's recommendations (with many thanks for the hard work to determine them and for the explanation of judder reduction setting):"Settings via THX optimizer, January 16, 2013 By C. Koehler"This review is from: Samsung UN40EH6000 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black) (Electronics)I used the THX Optimizer found on Tron (20th Anniversary Collector's Edition). The settings I came up with are as follows:Menu --> PictureMode: MovieBacklight: 20Contrast: 100Brightness: 44Sharpness: 20 -- (actually used a Disney animated movie to get this right. The black outlines of characters will have a white glow if you set this too high)Color: 50Tint: G50/R50Advanced Settings:_Color Space: Auto_Gamma: 0_Dynamic Contrast: Low_Black Tone: Darkest (I have it set to Dark)_Flesh Tone: 0_Motion Lighting: OffPicture Options:_Color Tone: Standard_Size: Screen Fit_Digital Noise Filter: Off_HDMI Black Level: Normal_Film Mode: Off_Auto Motion Plus: -- (these are my settings, see below for explanation*)__Custom:___Blur Reduction: 10___Judder Reduction: 3_LED Motion Plus: Off*Auto Motion Plus, specifically the Judder Reduction option, makes motion on the screen appear to be very smooth. It adds depth to the picture, like a diorama with distinct foreground and background. It is visually appealing for some movies, but a distraction in others -- if you have Judder Reduction set to 10 for maximum smoothness, it will in some cases make the special effects stand out too much and look fake. I have discovered that a setting of 3 is a fair compromise, you may decide differently.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55EH6000 55 inch LED TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: After much research and pricing among many models and brands we decided to go for the basic model from Samsung's line up.  We just could not argue with the picture for the price nor could we justify the huge price jump when looking at comparable models which offer Smart and 3D features.  We own an Xbox 360 with LIVE that offers movie and music streaming as well as an internet explorer app so our Smart needs are pretty much already met for what we use it for.  Fellow reviewers have also mentioned several alternative add on's if you desire said features so I encourage anyone to look into those options and save more than a few bucks.We took delivery of this TV on November 29th 2012 and to date (12/13/12)  we have been more than happy with our purchase.  This TV replaced a 2007 26 inch 720P LCD Toshiba Regza so the jump in size and picture quality is quite a bit so I apologize if I may have a bias in this review.I'll start this off withPROS:Thin designVery thin bezelSuper light for it's size  about 45 lbsexcellent picture and contrastCONS:None really for me but I would list a lack of ports for those out there who love options.Picture:The picture quality of this TV is phenomenal.  Super bright display, whites are brilliantly white while blacks are deep rich and dark and the colors are vibrant and vivid.  Do spend some time calibrating the TV yourself as our eyes are all different and a few settings on here I did not like for my viewing needs.  ( plus why wouldn't you want to spend time playing with it?)  There is a plethora of calibration options to tweak the picture as you see fit and I probably spent about a week tweaking the TV until I felt the picture was optimal for our needs.  Don't keep your first settings as your eyes adjust to the new screen you'll more than likely readjust the picture.  DO NOT judge this set based on over the air or cable TV.  It simply made the picture look like garbage.  DVD's Bluray PS3 XBOX are what you want to judge the picture on, then you will see just how gorgeous your new set can be.  I would calibrate your TV with a DVD or Bluray movie that has a wide range of whites blacks and colors.  The contrast between white and black is out of this world.  I have never seen such dark deep blacks on super bright whites on any other TV.  I am thoroughly impressed as it takes dark themed movies and games to a whole new level for me personally.  The colors are brilliant and rich however you may want to tone the out of the box setting down as the colors can be unrealistically bright with LED's.  It is a showcase of how vivid LED tech can be.  Lastly you have the ability to tweak auto motion plus 120hz settings or use presets for fast scenes which I love and the ability to turn it off which is a huge plus because with it on it can give a movie that super ultra realism that quite frankly can take away from a movie. So that is an awesome feature as there are some instances I use it and some where I don't want it at all.  Overall we are in love with the picture quality and could not be happier.Menu:The menu system is very easy to navigate and really quick compared to our old set.  I am happy with the organization of menu and sub menu and how quickly I can go through settings and change things around.  It is really responsive.  That is really all I could ask for in a menu system.Remote:It's a remote and it works for me very well.  Great feature is that it has back lit buttons.  responsive operation and seems well built.  Only time will tell.Design:We love the design of the TV from the super thin bezel to the light weight which made it easy to lift and install to our mount.  It does not get very hot at all compared to our old LCD and the depth thickness of the set is still really thin to us, so it wasn't an issue that it wasn't made with current razor thin tech.  Just the right amount of ports for me personally, I know some will argue that but I can only speak for myself.  The 55 inch screen is perfect for our viewing room which is on the smaller side so overall this TV has fit our needs very well.Value:Considering screen size, design with no bells or whistles just an awesome beautiful picture for a great price.  I would have to place the value as pretty high.  We didn't need nor want any of the other features of higher end models and the savings from choosing a basic model is a very nice thing and makes the bank account very happy.  Plus it leaves us money to add a new home theater system in the very near future so how can we argue with that?Simply a great TV, great size screen, great picture for a much lower price than a Smart/3D set.Overall this has been a great buy for our needs and we are very happy and have had no issues thus far.  We did purchase a 4 year warranty to be on the safe side of things, because as we know there will always be a percentage margin for manufacturing errors and or defective parts from suppliers.  Nothing is perfectly manufactured so they do pop up from time to time.  That is just part of the game, so with anything in this price range a warranty purchase was no question.I would highly recommend this model for anyone looking for a great TV,  not a TV trying to be a computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: C. Pierce
Reviews.Content: Got this TV a week ago. Happy so far. Crisp clear picture that doesn't need much tweaking. Indoor scenes are a little too dark, so I need to make some adjustments, but not sure what to adjust. Will need to research that :-). I like the thin border around the screen, although it's shiny & I find it a little distracting. The non-glare screen is very nice!It takes 2 people to unpack & set up this big TV. Installing pedestal is a breeze, of course, with just some screws (my husband's job). Attaching cables very easy (my job). Remember you need component or HDMI cable (not included with TV) to get HD picture. I can't comment on the sound because I installed external speakers. TV has optical input, so it was a simple connection.I would like to have had more than 2 HDMI ports. I connected DVD player with component cables, & will use the remaining HDMI port for Apple TV (when I get it).Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: CBUK
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded  from a 40 inch Samsung LCD that was about 5 years old. This new TV has a great picture. The LED technology makes the picture come alive. Almost 3D like in nature. Very sharp details and no ghosting on sports shows. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal (on another site)
Reviews.Author: JH
Reviews.Content: I agree with the below posts about the review. This is a great TV. However, do not buy it for 1500, 1100, $1000, etc. Right now if you go onto dell.com it is $1000 (down from 1399) and you get a $400 dell gift card (which i used to turn around and buy the samsung 40'' on their site, which i got another $150 gift card with, which i turned around and bought both mounts with). In all, $1000 got me a 55'' samsung, a 40'' samsung, and 2 wall mounts. Not bad at all...

Reviews.Title: A "Dumb" TV for a Smart Consumer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was really looking to eventually get the ES8000 series (top of the line) when I could afford it, but when BB dropped the price for Black Friday to $799, I had to really consider this instead.I love Samsung TVs (and galaxy phones).  For me they are my Apple.  I think no other brand compares to the clarity that they achieve in their panels.  Typically a Samsung TV is priced higher than the competition and for good reason, they are worth their price.  I have research and compared various brands in person to Samsung televisions and there are no other manufacturers that have as nice a screen image.This is a LED back-lit LCD (~3-4 inches thick).  I think for the image it is the best option as LCDs have lower contrast, Edge-lit LED (~ 1 in thick) have the halo'ing or flashlighting problems).  It is actually a tapered design so it looks thinner than it is if you are worried about that.  Having the thin bezel makes a huge difference!As has been pointed out, this is not a "smart" tv.  I have a desktop PC, PS3 hooked up to it so that isn't really a need for me.The auto-motion preference is fairly good.  I used to have the ln55c630 and that was 120 Hz too, but this one has some other techniques that Samsung is calling CMR, which simulates 240 Hz.  I don't think it is quite like 240 Hz, but it is better than the normal 120 Hz. Like my old samsung tv this one also occasionally "judders", but for $799 you can't get anything that performs better than this one.  My brother-in-law has a Vizio and its auto-motion capabilities are much worse.  You have the option of turning it off, but I really like it.  When turned on it can get rid of the movie feel, but I think it is really sweet, because it seems like you are there in the movie.  A good auto-motion (frame interpolation) is a must for my viewing preferences.There are only 2 HDMIs, but I use a home theater receiver so not an issue at all.Some people have complained the remote is a little small.  I think that is better as compared to having to hold a huge remote.  Much more comfortable.Overall, if you want a plain (not smart) tv with a stunning picture this is really your only choice and for $799 there is no argument.

Reviews.Title: Big bright picture, great HD at affordable price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have looked a many tv's for over three months, researching at amazon, visiting in the big box stores, read reviews here and on cnet and finally realized i would n't need wifi or any smart options. What I wanted was a large screen, crisp picture and great price. I am happy to say I got what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Good picture after a day or two
Reviews.Author: robin
Reviews.Content: Wanted to replace my 42" Vizio with a larger set. After looking for about a month at the brick and mortar stores, I decided on the 55" Samsung . Didn't need the Internet access or 3D. I pull Internet off my bluray. 3D doesn't appear to be going anywhere yet. Amazon's price was cheaper so I bought here. Ordered on Sunday and it arrived on Friday. I was not happy with the picture the first day. I spent a lot of time in the menus trying to adjust to my liking. The colors were washed out and the reds looked pink. The black on this was excellent and the only thing i liked about the tv. I was about ready to return this tv. The next day, I noticed there was a firmware update on samsungs website. I loaded it on a flash drive and transferred it to the tv. The firmware helped somewhat, but I still wasn't happy with the picture. I left the tv on when I left the house for the day. When I came back home, the picture was better. I don't know if there is a break in period on these tv's , perhaps someone could tell me. I went into the menus and adjusted the picture from a better starting point.I am now very, very happy with the quality of the picture.  The price was very reasonable for a 55" tv. I just wasn't able to justify the upgrade for the Internet and 3d. Someone tell me why you can get a bluray player with Internet apps for under $120, and it's a $400 dollar upgrade for this tv.I am keeping this tv. Now that I've had it a few day, it's a great value with an excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!  Amazing Picture Quality!
Reviews.Author: Jim C. "Art Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up.  Great Delivery!  Love this TV.  All the picture adjustment features and sound features are easy to use and change.  The screen is impeccable.  The flatness is of course a modern miracle even though it's not the flattest screen out there.  I've owned this TV now for a few weeks, and absolutely love it.  Added the Blu-ray Player for certain SMART capabilities the TV didn't have, but at a fraction of the price of the SMART TVs.  Love to watch movies on this, I'm very pleased!!!

Reviews.Title: samsung 55 inch LED for 800....sign me up
Reviews.Author: anish
Reviews.Content: samsung is one of the best tv manufacturers if not the best imo and you cant beat samsung quality for 800 for a 55 inch tv. no frills no wifi no apps or anything. just a tv. but good enough for me,,,,especially at the price.only complaint is that whoever they contract with to deliver is horrible. didnt even have a screwdriver to screw base into the screen....i had literally just moved and didnt have my own. then one guy goes "usually we just bring the box up" - i say ok fine,,,, then they ask me to fill out a form saying they set the tv up and tested it. BS

Reviews.Title: samsung 60 LED
Reviews.Author: Samsung & Sony are the best.
Reviews.Content: I love it the most. I don't need the wifi connection or streaming apps. If you want the purest picture, simple set up and incredibly low power usage $115 dollars a year (two hours a day) than this is the best you can buy. The motion rate is the highest out of all the sets I looked at. The 1080p is mind blowing. Literally will change the way you look at film production value because it is so clear and vivid.  The menue is simple and easy to use. I recommend the Standard setting for picture quality.

Reviews.Title: This TV Rocks Especially for the Price
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: There were two reasons I bought this TV.1. Size2. PriceThis TV is both a marvelous machine and a great value. Having upgraded from a 32'' CRT HDTV (laugh, I know) I was blown away by the size and intensity of this Samsung LED TV. The picture is huge, vivid, and crystal clear. I've watched HDTV, Blu Rays, Netflix, and played both Xbox 360 and PS3 and have been pleased with everything. The picture is awesome.Don't be mislead. The TV is as advertised. It's not smart and it is not 3D. If you want Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, etc. you will need a player or console of some sort. It does play DivX and other Avi files via USB if you have any of those lying around.The bottom line is this TV is big, good looking, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: J. Angele Sharrett
Reviews.Content: My first post review of this TV was bad, we were very upset with the picture quality on this tv. It looked like someone filmed everyshow with a regular Video camera. A wonderful person who read our review told us about a "film mode" you have to adjust. When you first get the tv it comes film mode off, so you have to go in and manually put it on auto. As soon as we did that it was like a whole new TV!!! no more video camera TV!! the picture quality is now what i would expect from a TV like this one! Many, many thanks go out to the person who read our review and gave us that tip! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: only good as a paper weight
Reviews.Author: wendy jorgenson
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung 55" TV  two years ago. Now it will not turn on. I called Samsung and they said they will not fix it. I have to pay for repair!!  I really do not belive a life span of a fancy TV should be less than two years.  I paid $1000 for this TV and I only watched it a couple of hours a day. It it the worst product I have ever bought.Model#UN55d6000sfxza, serial#z2z73cxb901466hDo not buy a Samsung TV

Reviews.Title: Yes, I am a Samsung fanboy.
Reviews.Author: Sidphx
Reviews.Content: I own three TVs, one monitor and one DVD player...all made by Samsung. Why I like Samsung: my first Samsung TV, way after the warranty had expired, began to experience a problem in turning on. On the web I saw that this problem was somewhat common with my particular model. It turned out that Samsung had gotten a batch of bad capacitors. After contacting Samsung, they sent out a local service/repair technician to my home, at my convenience, to replace those faulty components at no charge to me.  I am in my sixties and had never before experienced, nor heard of, such a responsible action undertaken by a major manufacturer. Now that is a company that one would/should support. Again...it was past the warranty period.As to the picture quality of this model, in my, no doubt, biased opinion, it is the reference that other manufacturers must measure up to. Colors are very true. You can select from three modes; Standard/Movie/Dynamic.  What is animprovement is the higher refresh rate; dark scenes display better. I also like that this is not edge-lit. I have an evenly lit image over the entire screen. A bonus is the ability to access movies/pictures/music from an inserted thumb drive. Another bonus is the Energy Star rating...estimated yearly energy expense based on five hours of daily use is $12 [twelve].Having a PS3 and a Roku I did not need a 'smart TV' and I think 3D is overpriced.One thing that does need improving, though this might be unique to my set, is the HDMI receptacles. They seem to not be very sturdy/secure, but as I don't often plug and unplug my cables this is not an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for most of us
Reviews.Author: Joshua E. Merry "joshmerry"
Reviews.Content: When looking for a new TV, I did a TON of research both on brands and on various technologies.  There are a lot of different opinions out there which have been formed in a lot of different ways using a lot of different criteria.I settled on this TV because of the price, the positive reviews, and the brand equity of Samsung.I mounted it this past Saturday, and I am so happy with it.  Out of the box you see a bit of the 'soap opera' effect, but two simple tweaks fix all of that.  You can make many other tweaks if you want to fine tune the picture, but that's personal preference.I am not a videophile, but I like a good picture, and I am extremely pleased with this.  I watch HD movies, HD TV, and play PS3.  Unless you are a video snob, this TV will be great.So I would argue that for the price, it's an awesome television.  I'm trying to think of something negative to say, but I can't.  Maybe it's a bit thick?  That's because of the full array LED lighting, which I'm happy with.I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Buy this one!!
Reviews.Author: Fanboy "Janusz.D"
Reviews.Content: I was browsing for a new Tv that my sis wanted as her own. andfound this Led tv. The picture is Great. Amazing for the priceactually. And heck, it even has a usb port, which doesn'ton my old plasma.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Curdog
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN55EH6000 is a lower end TV that is a bit thicker than the new LEDs and lacks some features such as multiple jacks.  That said the picture is excellent and the set works great.  We have it set up in our basement and have no need for electronic accessories.  If you don't need the fancy staff, this basic set will not only your needs but make you smile each time you watch it.  The motion is just fine for watching sports.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer Service Stellar as Always
Reviews.Author: P. Johnson
Reviews.Content: The first TV we received had a vertical line of dead pixels.  As always, Amazon exceeded expectations in handling the exchange.  The second unit is flawless.Note that this TV is not a Smart TV which makes it more cost effective than comparably sized Smart TVs.  The last TV we purchased was a Smart TV and we were disappointed by the non-user friendliness of the 'Smart' functionality.  We ended up using our purple branded media puck for streaming and so on this TV I didn't want to pay extra for 'Smart' functionality that I suspect would pale in comparison to the purple puck.The picture is excellent and the sound is acceptable.  We watched a couple of shows with the TV sound before hooking it up to the Bose sound system.  I appreciate that the power cord has a right angle plug on it which will make it easier to wall mount over-top of an outlet.Some reviewers complained about the flimsiness of the stand.  While I recognize there is flex in the stand I would submit to you that it is sturdier than more rigid stands.  My other TV(same size),  has a rigid stand and if you bump it the stand will lift off the table surface while this unit's stand will allow the TV to flex and have the stand stay firmly planted on the table surface.  My old TV I ended up mounting on the wall partially due to concern of the stand.  If I end up mounting this TV on the wall it won't be due to concern over the stand.My only gripe with this TV is the lack of being able to customize the name of the inputs.  We are using 3 inputs, OTA in the antenna input, the purple puck on HDMI-1 and a PC running XBMC in HDMI-2.  On some other TVs you could update the name of one of the inputs to XBMC.  I've not tried the USB input feature yet.If I had to do it over again, I'd buy this TV again.

Reviews.Title: We love it.
Reviews.Author: kathy moore
Reviews.Content: works great and we are very happy with it.  It is a great tv and I don't know wh at else to say.  We bought it because hubby was having probs with macular degeneration and needed a brighter type screen even though we had a 72 inch tv.  This one is brighter and he is happy with it.

Reviews.Title: So far Great
Reviews.Author: Bernadine M. Rolniak
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple reviews from the so called pros and people who had purchased TV out there, I decided to go with Samsung.  I believer in you get what you pay for in life.  Once I choose the brand now the dilemma of which features and size. LDE, LCD, Plasma, 120Hz, 240Hz or more?  Did I want a Smart TV, a 3D?  What size TV 50” 55” gazillion “.  How heavy, how thick?  So many options so many questions.  I ruled out the 3D quickly, figured I have Apple TV so don’t need the Smart TV option (do I really want to surf the net on my couch on a 50” screen? no LOL).  I decided on the UN55EH6000 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV.  Relatively light without the stand (45lbs) and was easy to mount on the wall.  I took the advice of another reader (Jason) and set up the TV for viewing.  I had it up and running in minutes.  WOW what a great picture. I thought my older TV was good but not compared to this TV.  Beautiful HD picture, it looks good at night or with some natural light.  There are plenty TV out there with similar features and you can save a few dollars. However I have been burned before and decided to pay a little extra for a better brand (keeping my fingers crossed).Pros: Easy to use/set-up, great picture, good value, Amazon (got it delivered in 3 days)Cons:  little pricey, only 2 HDMI slots, sound is ok

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift!
Reviews.Author: Amanda M. Texido "Amanda"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this gift for a special aunt and uncle for Christmas.  Setup was easy, and the picture is gorgeous!  The sound is excellent also.  I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Thank You - Great Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Bob Hamsund
Reviews.Content: We purchased this 55" TV for our living room, since we have the same 55" Samsung TV in our basement.  The color and brightness of this TV is awesome.  We had some delivery arrangement problems due to my fault - I gave them the wrong phone number.Thanks for all your help!!Bob Hamsund

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Douglas B. Jose
Reviews.Content: It took a while to get the color right and learn how to use the controls, but it's worth it: I get a get picture now!

Reviews.Title: Love my new tv.
Reviews.Author: SHAKESPEARE
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time...installation was quick and unexpected. Price was great. can't ask for moreLove the picture quality...great deal !!

Reviews.Title: excellent! but...
Reviews.Author: fisherKing
Reviews.Content: just got this today; coming from a 2009 samsung 40". the differences are phenomenal. picture out of the box is great, i've tweaked it a bit...and will explore that more over next few days. but overall...amazing picture. the depth, clarity, definition...it's like a veil was lifted, compared to the previous set (and makes me wonder what tv will look like three years from now...hopefully glasses-free 3D).i ordered this wednesday, was scheduled for delivery friday; ceva called and came thursday. unboxed, set it up...even took the packaging. amazon is, as always, my fave retailer!am using this exclusively with a roku box, and everything looks great. first movie: the avengers (from amazon) and feels like looking thru a window.i considered a plasma tv; they have great color, contrast...but the depth and clarity of an led-lit tv cannot be beat (well, not at this price).worth every penny.EDIT: about a week in, and i am trying to get over the shock of seeing film look like video...and NOT adapting to that. so a little googling, and i discover "the soap opera effect".if you go to Advanced Settings, you can turn off samsungs "Auto Motion Plus"...and film will again look like FILM. so far, this is MUCH BETTER...!EDIT2: why i just docked this a star...just got a surround system, and then...discovered that the optical out from the tv does NOT pass 5.1 audio thru, only stereo. it's 2012, this is a NEW tv, but it won't do this..!!! am very disappointed, i just had to buy a switcher so i can route my roku box to the switcher, then video (thru hdmi) to the tv, and 5.1 audio to my sound system thru optical. UGH. i don't understand why the tv will not pass dolby audio to the optical out.

Reviews.Title: Great TV if it works.
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung LN40C500, which was a good TV but was known to have some faulty capacitor breaking after 2/3 years. While I managed to repair it (soldering new capacitor on the TV mother board), the tv worked fine but I was suspicious about Samsung TV. Apparently, it was a known issue.Then, in may 2012, I decided to go bigger and purchase a Samsung UN55H6000 55 Inch. Great TV, sharp picture, 120Hz option to smooth the picture so everything fast moving like Sports looks great (better stop this option when watching a movie, otherwise the picture would not look natural).I love how the frame is small. Something new in newer LCD.However, my TV broke after 2 months. A 2 inches thick horizontal line appeared one day. Not, not just a line. Depending on the picture you have on the TV, some artefact are poping up everywhere. You can watch TV, but you may have seizures after a while. I contacted Samsung and received a call the next day from a local repair store. Apparently, it's a "bad panel" and the part needs to be ordered. Two weeks later, still no news since apparently the part is not there.I gave a second chance to samsung and I regret it. I really don't look forward to be next year when the warranty will stop.The TV is great when it works. But, for how long will it work ?I am disappointed in Samsung. I would recommend this TV if it did not break. But it's my second Samsung TV having issues after 2 years. So it's a matter a luck, or just samsung getting bad. By seeing so much people complaining, well, I just think it's not a luck issue.If a Samsung representative was reading this, I would be more than happy to have a free extended warranty.I could not watch the Olympic Games :/TV Picture Quality : ****TV Sound Quality: *** (but you will never have good sound from a tv lol)TV Functionnality: ***** (I believe Smart TV are a steal. Better have a little HTPC/Apple TV that you may update)TV Looks: ****TV composant quality: * (Well, it broke, as well as my previous Samsung. So.................nop, Samsung TV are cheap in the inside for me)Samsung Warranty: * (1 year warranty, in home service ? ASUS has a 3 years warranty and send you a new screen. That's what I call a good warranty)Overall satisfaction: ** (Could have been a **** if it did not break :( )==============UPDATE 08/16/2012:==============TV still not repaired after two 17 days of problems. I contacted Samsung who basically told me my inquiry was...canceled. So again, the part has to be ordered again.I believe the TV might be repaired after a month.SAMSUNG CUSTOMER SERVICE : *==============UPDATE 08/27/2012==============TV has been repaired today (1 month after I called samsung). Basically, the whole screen was changed. The motherboard was the only thing kept. It basically cost 3/4 of the whole TV. So if you panel breaks after the warranty, it will be worth buying a new one. Let's hope that nothing will break after this small 1 year warranty (I recently returned my ASUS screen for a couple dead pixels. The screen was send back using FedEx, free of charge. A new screen was sent ASA they received my screen. That's what I called a good warranty again!).Again, TV is great. If it doesn't break.==============Update 02/23/2012==============As requested by an Amazoner, here is a little update:TV is working great. Since they have changed the panel, TV is responding well with a clear and sharp picture. Not slow to turn on (issue on some Samsung tv that may need minutes to start up due to faulty capacitor).Again, I do not regret not having a Smart TV as I think a small media center is better. I watch Netflix or personal movies via wifi using my Apple TV. I have plugged a computer and played on it with an amazing picture.Again, my 3* star review is due to lack of quality of my TV set that I received and a slow customer service. If nothing would have occur, it would have been a 4.5*

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice - one weird thing
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Mills "Me"
Reviews.Content: I'm sure most people buying this TV already know this.  But the 240hz processing simulation (or whatever it's called) can be annoying.  On some older movies which may be at slower speeds, not HD, with fast action there is some blurring where the TV tries to interpollate an image for each of the 4? extra frames in between those which were in the original movie (shot at 24 frame/sec).  You can turn the feature off (sadly my wife still thought it was doing it).  There may be a purpose for this feature in video games or other types of movies where it's helpful, but it was more annoying than anything.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, pixel went out second week
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I got this tv on sale for 800. Its a great tv and worth far more than what i spent. Only downfall is that a pixel went out after a week. Luckily its in the bottom corner and is hard to notice. Hopefully no more go out or this review will definitely change.

Reviews.Title: WOW factor TV - 55EH6000
Reviews.Author: M. Underwood
Reviews.Content: Update: March 27 2013TV still excellent. No dead pixels.  Did I say I just looove the black background?  Just found a firmware update dated March 2014 on the Samsung site (First one since June 2012.) Put in a USB thumbdrive and it installed without a hitch, about 8 MB. Can't tell offhand what changes resulted.  Upgraded my antenna 5 months ago and now pulling in 20 channels.**********Update: Sept 27 2013TV still working great. No dead pixels at all. Very pleased. Just went to Samsung site to look for any USB updates. Strangely, the model is not even listed.**********Update: Edit Jan 15 2013Ran a cable from our outdoor antenna to the TV.  I now get 16 over the air (ota) channels here in Toronto. Beautiful, 720p or 1080i high def stations, wow.  Channels take about 2 seconds to change, which seems good.  As one other commenter mentioned, if auto program does not find a station then you can't add one manually. You can add channels manually for cable however (which I don't have).Continue to be very impressed with this TV.*********Update: Edit Jan 6 2013TV still working flawlessly. Obtained a USB stick, downloaded website firmware update and discovered that the firmware on the TV is more recent than what is on Samsung's website.  Informed Samsung, who apologized.720p mp4 home movies from my camera and played from the USB stick look incredible.My formerly smeared screen (from a one time mis-cleaning with a household cleaner) is now pristine again thanks to distilled water mixed with isopropyl alcohol in an atomizer, and a microfibre cloth.Surprised that turning on/off the TV does not turn on/off our new sony s590 blu-ray player or visa versa.  No biggie.**********Our first LCD TV, bought on Boxing Day for a crazy low price - $900.  From AVS forums I learned that the screen characteristics vary with the particular model number which is on a label the box.  The model number on ours was TH02, which I had heard was a good one, so I snatched it up.Unboxing and then attaching the base was straightforward, best with two people. I have set the TV temporarily on our black piano bench and oriented diagonally, filling up a small corner. While sitting on the couch eye level is half way up the screen. Very pleased with the look.The picture: just WOW. We don't even have blu-rays yet, just DVDs playing on a new blu-ray sony blu-ray s590 player. I used the calibration settings from a person on AVS forums for this particular model (TH02) of the EH6000 series.The clearness, crispness, colors, blacklevels, off angle viewing, motion handling - all exceeded expectations.  My family is mesmerized at how good DVDs can look. My kids have friends with large screens in their homes, and when they came over during the holidays they commented on how much more clear and real the picture is than their TVs at home.  This is our first big screen TV and I must confess getting such a huge beautiful screen for less than a thousand dollars is a little surreal.  Even the sound of this TV is monstrous. We've never had a need to put it to a third of it's maximum. Maybe it's the result of corner loading, don't know.  One can tweak the sound settings to put more emphasis on voice than effects if desired. Movie mode sounded very fine indeed. In time I'll upgrade to a receiver and speakers and of course a subwoofer, but this TV surprisingly does not make that an urgent matter at all.Once I acquire a USB stick I'll update the firmware, if it needs it.I still have to run a cable from our outdoor antennae to the TV and will update at how it goes. We've never subscribed to cable or satellite so I can't comment on the picture that way.A gripe? On the TV Handling Guide sheet it says this:"Screen Care Guide  - do not spray cleaning solution directly onto the TV screen. Spray the solution onto a cleaning cloth first, and then clean the screen"What it doesn't tell you is that the TV should be off and cool and the only "cleaning solution" that should be used is a mixture of isopropyl (rubbing) alcohol and distilled water, *not* household cleaners like Windex. Also the cloth should be microfibre, like those soft ones that are used to clean glasses or cell phones. Paper towels will scratch. Common household cleaners will smear and possibly harm the (non glass!) screen.  Yes I found out the hard way.  If the screen is off and sunlight catches it, the smears show, otherwise not.Anyway. Easily 5 out of 5 stars. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED TV
Reviews.Author: D. Monroe "dermon"
Reviews.Content: This TV was just delivered from Amazon a few days ago. I also own another 55inch LCD TV from Samsung, which has been running and looking great for more than a year now. This new LED TV has amazing picture quality, and was up and running out of the box within just a few minutes. Given the price, this TV is excellent and I would highly recommend it.UPDATE: 1 year later, the TV is still awesome.

Reviews.Title: The perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Though this TV only has two HDMI inputs, thats all I needed. The picture is the best I have ever seen. I added a Apple TV and called it a day.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Joyce A
Reviews.Content: This TV is easy to set up even for me. The picture quality is great fo the price. I wish it had 3 HDMI inputs but it only has two which is not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: Personal Enjoyment
Reviews.Author: RickyB
Reviews.Content: this tv was more than just what was required it met all my needs and then some I would happily recommend this item to any of my friends. Thank you for a great item

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Joe Caldwell
Reviews.Content: Once calibrated and setup properly this TV is fantastic. I love that I didn't pay for a lot of "smart" features that I don't need since I already have a TiVo , PS3, etc. The 120Hz settings are a little confusing at first, but once the right setting is chosen things look great (the smoothing effects look like crap, but you can and should disable them). The only con for me is the lack of ports (I would have liked another component and a couple more HDMI), however, my receiver has tons of HDMI ports so it's not that big of a drawback.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: D. Far "Student"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv used when It was on sale for 550 dollars.Since then the picture has been amazing, and the interface and options have been wonderful to have.There is a pixel that every once and a while goes dead, but after a few minutes snaps back to life.  Probably a sign that it's going to die, but so far, I'm impressed for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG 55E
Reviews.Author: vrystaat
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 year old TV.On the Smarthub, in order to get Amazon Prime movies you need to go through an agonizing process of updates. After a total of 12 tries, I gave up. The Samsung website is chaotic and gives no information. If you wish to watch streaming with your TV, get another brand.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kevin Norton
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes great screens. The picture is fantastic, especially for the price. I have it in my living room. I don't live in a very large house but this size is more than enough for a couch about 11 feet away.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic buy if you just need a set with a great picture without all the internet bells & whistles
Reviews.Author: Kimo "Aloha Hiker"
Reviews.Content: I have a home theater complete with a HD front projector, 5.1 HD surrond sound, a Bluray player, Roku player, as well as HD receiver that's connected to the net.  What I wanted in a HD TV were three things:  1.)  I wanted one that gave me a great HD picture WITHOUT all of the Internet connectivity bells & whistles;  2.)  I wanted one that wasn't 3D (what a rip-off that technology has turned out to be!!);  3.) I wanted keep my investment low (around a grand) as I will be buying a new OLED set once they're out a few years and the price is reasonable.  So, after weeks of research and looking at many sets in the big box stores, the Samsung UN55EH6000 55" was the top choice for me.  Picture-wise, this set out-performs others that cost hundreds more because the UN55EH6000 doesn't have the Internet, 3D bells & whistles built into it's cost.  I bought it for just under a grand about a year ago and it still produces the same beautiful picture as the day I first turned it on.  So, if your requirements are like mine you won't go wrong with this TV!!  One more thing, I saw where one of the reviewers stated that this set was not 55".  However, if you read his review closely, he states that he measured the screen side to side.  Most everyone knows that the size of a TV's screen is determined by measuring it diagonally - not side to side.  When you pull the measuring tape correctly on this set, it measures a full 55".

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT.
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Not sure why they call it a 55" since it is just under 50" wide, but this was the exact size I needed for the space where I was going to put it.  Samsung's excellent reputation for quality TVs is upheld/undoubtable in my experience thus far.  Very please with the purchase.  The delivery guys who brought were also great.  They seemed to handle the TV with the same amount of care as I would.

Reviews.Title: I Dont know?
Reviews.Author: bryant
Reviews.Content: After a year from having this tv it has broken.The HDMI doesnt work which i hated because i play ps3 and watch netflix in occasions and now i cant because when i plug in the HDMI cable the tV screen starts flickering and sometimes the tv screen just goes blank ,so now i just watch regular tv and sometimes the screen starts to flicker and its not in hdmi input.In Conclusion i believe this samsung tv i have has a few more months to live but other than that it looks really great,but if your willing to take the risk like i did.Go for it.Good luck

Reviews.Title: High Quality TV
Reviews.Author: Kenia Dib
Reviews.Content: This TV has a simple design but is elegant. The picture is clean and crisp. The colors are vibrant. The quality is high and the HD makes it look real.  I highly recommend this make and model.

Reviews.Title: I have a problem with mine -- lightning flash.
Reviews.Author: Haywood D. Giles "Watch collector"
Reviews.Content: I usually like SAMSUNG TVs, but I bought this one for a friend and it has an occasional lightning flash at the top (12 o clock) of the screen.  It has lasted a while and not completely gone out, but otherwise the picture is nice.  It was too much trouble to return it, so I just went on with it.  I learned my lesson though.  I will never buy a TV over the internet...much easier to make a return to a brick and mortar store if something were wrong.  the lightning flash is annoying, but my friend never mentioned it...he seems to be happy with it, so I just kept my mouth shut about it.

Reviews.Title: Impressed with TV
Reviews.Author: Backwoods "ekjk"
Reviews.Content: Great picture,  my  screen is  almost equal to friends HD display, they are surprised of the clarity.  On the  animated HD channels it  looks like 3D, absolutely super picture quality.I find the menu much more user friendly than others I have had in the past. Same with the remote.I have a 32" and very pleased with it also, other than the screen size, I find it to be of the same quality display.Highly recommend this unit.I had to pose a question to Samsung Tech Support (issue with my cable box) made the call and "POOF," quick menu and response, someone I could relate to and understand, that alone is amazing any more.As with most TVs the only issue I have is the speaker location, tend to project from the back rather than the front and due to hearing issues, need to crank the volume up.

Reviews.Title: The best choice I could have made
Reviews.Author: Roberta Loufek, MSN, RN
Reviews.Content: This HDTV looks great, and works wonderfully. And I don't even have TV hooked up - I have a Ruku and VCR/DVD player. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Karla RN
Reviews.Content: Love it great picture. Easy to use. I have always been a fan of Samsung and will continue to be. They make a great product!

Reviews.Title: So pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: Grandmama that loves games
Reviews.Content: We are so pleased with the Samsung TV.  Great game watching on larger screen.  Wonderful quality!  The only complaint is one from my husband (had to buy new console on which to place it!)

Reviews.Title: Great screen
Reviews.Author: Jeff Shaw
Reviews.Content: Wish it had more hdmi inputs put good workhorse.  No issues with second delivery.  First came broken, but Amazon did a great job of keeping me happy.  Good deal for the quality of picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: GameLova
Reviews.Content: Everything is crisp and beautiful. Sound is iffy but it's not bad if you don't want to buy a sound bar.Only complaint is it doesn't have enough HDMI/AV cable inputs...

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: sean tucker
Reviews.Content: This tv has become my baby, I am in love with this tv the graphics are amazing and the frame rate is miraculous!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Snarr
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because it was on sale during black Friday. I was a little hesitant because I'd never bought a TV that was this expensive before (even after the huge price cut from black Friday). But, I couldn't be happier with it! The colors are fantastic, the sound is great, and the size if amazing.I use this for playing games. I used to play on an old 720p 60hz. So, going to a 1080p 120hz beast was amazing! It's like playing games for the first time all over again.I would buy this TV again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: debbi
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful set with amazing clarity and color....should of bought it A LONG time ago :-)I previously had a 37", and I'm beyond happy with this bigger, better tv!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV; but one dislike
Reviews.Author: Hill
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV just before the Superbowl. It was delivered on time, and installed easily (much lighter than my last flat screen TV). I considered this TV because I didn't need anything "Smart" or with 3D, so I didn't want to pay for those features. In general, the performance of the TV is GREAT! Very vivid video. Audio is ok, but I plan to add a sound bar anyhow.However, there is one significant thing that I dislike... both HDMI inputs are on the side (none on the back). So, when installing the HDMI cable, it will either stick out the side, or one would have to bend it pretty significantly to hide it behind the TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazon and Samsung, a match made in Heaven
Reviews.Author: Donald Murphy "DMurph"
Reviews.Content: First, I'm very particular of where I purchase online products these days especially after running into a lot of scrupulous vendors and deals, but not with Amazon. I've always found what I want with them and when they have there usual deals or price chops, and I do mean price chops, they always have great bargains. Secondly, I've been researching the net for years now in reference to HDTV's and have concluded that Samsung is the best for my choices. I purchased this HD LED TV a month ago and have found it to be just what I had in mind a good HDTV should be. From all the setting  options to the quality of picture and sound this is the most dynamic set I've ever purchased and with the price that Amazon came down on it at the time I bought it, it's been heaven sent to me. Thanks Amazon for all my past, present and future products.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money Saved
Reviews.Author: knows what time it is :)
Reviews.Content: Novice techno I am --  did lots of research for a standard, no super frills TV and came up with this.  Have had 3 month with no problems.  Very happy with the set and its capabilities.  I knew what I was getting and have no complaints.Set up easy.  Used previous reviews and comments for assistance  ( didn't really need too much even though seriously I am all thumbs technically).Amazon delivery was quick and appointment kept as promised.  Onward..........................

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Parlante
Reviews.Content: beautiful, arrived in excellent condition,without a scratch,quality superb! perfect size for the room, I would definitely suggest purchasing this tv to anyone

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Love the picture quality for a basic LED it works great so far. This set was a replacement for a 46" Sharp LCD and is just a little wider and alot lighter the Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Love it a lot
Reviews.Author: Igor J Colmenares
Reviews.Content: It was a great price for this awesome 55 inches HD TV set. nice colors and nice sound all at home love it

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sandie
Reviews.Content: I am in love with Samsung electronics and needed to purchase a nice, big, reliable tv and this fit the bill. It hasn't let me down thus far. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent in every way!
Reviews.Author: edward romer
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great sound, good colors, etc. Very good deal for the money although if I waited another 2 years I think I could have gotten it for under $500.

Reviews.Title: Good so far!
Reviews.Author: Zack
Reviews.Content: Took 2 shipments(FIRST WAS DOA) but It looks great now :) Loving the size! I need to try some other recommeneded settings though.Make sure to turn off Auto Motion Plus (soap opera effect).I use a roku3 and it's great.

Reviews.Title: 55 Inch High Quality Product
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Grose
Reviews.Content: This product has performed exactly as expected.  It was easy to install with Verizon FiOS and it has worked flawlessly from the day it was received.  Another high quality product from Amazon.com !!

Reviews.Title: GREATEST TV IN THE WORLD!!!
Reviews.Author: UNCLE SAMMY
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying this TV very much. Great price, Extremely good picture, sounds good, what more can you ask for!!!

Reviews.Title: nice colors, bad GUI
Reviews.Author: Ike Rye
Reviews.Content: This review is for one with TH02 panel with 1018 firmware.  This tv get's one star off for relatively low contrast, low brightness, narrow viewing angle and cheap flexible bezel and another for user interface/ease of use.I searched for large screen tv for a while.  I really wanted plasma as I like blacks to be black, large viewing angles and vibrant color.  However I had to write plasma off almost immediately when it become apparent that I cannot stand plasma flicker.  In addition, Viera ST had been discontinued and models similar in price where too glossy.As it become clear that LED is for me I zeroed in on either LG or Samsung.  I would have preferred LG (IPS panel, 3D) if not for uneven back-light.  Since I did not mind thick case I settled for Samsung EH.Speaking of back-light Samsung's is not entirely even either but it's barely visible as it's outside of the picture (black bars).The TV can look great once tweaked to source and offers satisfactory flesh tones and balanced if  a little flat colors.  Unfortunately each of the two HDMI ports can only have one profile.  That's not enough.  Adding insult to the injury features like brightness, backlight, motion plus, R/G balance are hard to access from the remote and on screen menus are s l o w, unresponsive.Brightness deserves a separate mention.  In a daylight lit room (no direct sunlight) brightness is satisfactory at 12-18.  This makes blur reduction feature (LED strobe) useless since maximum level is 20.Also worth mentioning is dynamic contrast and brightness.  I read few opinions that such features should be disabled.  When those features are off the panel is too gray and colors are flat so to me mentioned features save this product from getting two stars instead of three.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Skipper41
Reviews.Content: I waited for the price to come down on this TV. It had excellent ratings and the picture does not disappoint.The manual that comes with the TV is really poor. It does not even explain what some of the features on the TV are/do. Still, the tV is great.

Reviews.Title: So pretty :)
Reviews.Author: flowershopp
Reviews.Content: I know nothing about tvs.  I did all my research online, and trusted various sources for the best deal/quality of a TV.  I decided on the Samsung as I have a few friends/family members who have have samsung tv's and been very happy with them.  My last tv was a Vizio that lasted a year before it died...so yea, I'd rather pay a little more for something that will last.  So far, its been great.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: mike t
Reviews.Content: This was by far the biggest purchase we have ever made sight unseen online. We went strictly by reviews and price. We were not let down. This tv is absolutely beautiful.  You can't go wrong for under 1000$.  We wanted something with a great picture and no bells and whistles. Perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Simon Green
Reviews.Content: This TV rocks. I returned an insignia due to bad syncing of audio and strange soap-opera effects. Those 2 issues are both gone. I love this TV, and the sound is great for a thin panel LED.

Reviews.Title: Great value TV
Reviews.Author: T. Prentice
Reviews.Content: This TV replace a 46" Sony in my Family Room and I've been pleased with it!  One of the big knocks on this particular TV is the lack of internet capabilities and limited HDMi ports.  This is not a problem for me as I only need one HDMi port, as all of my components run through my audio receiver and I have internet capabilities on both my BluRay player and my DirecTV receiver.  Unless you're a videophile, you will enjoy the picture on the TV.  I went to CNET and used their optimal settings for the picture and have no complaints.  The small bezel means it takes up about the same amount of space on the wall as did the 46" I had up there previously.  This TV won't win any awards for bells and whistles, but for the price it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good TV for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Jag
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV (55") for a couple of months now and so far I am loving it. I haven't had any problems like spotting or something and hopefully it stays the same. It doesn't come with all the bells and whistles that the smart TVs come with, but I did not need those features. If you are looking for a big LED tv with a decent budget, this is the best one you can get.

Reviews.Title: THIS TV IS AWESOME
Reviews.Author: JOANN LAMAR
Reviews.Content: WE WAITED A LONG TIME TO PURCHASE A NEW TV, WE FINALLY SETTLED ON THIS 55'' SAMSUNG.  THE PICTURE IS SO REAL I JUST KEPT WATCHING BECAUSE I JUST COULD NOT BELIEVE HOW REAL THE PICTURE WAS.  OUR OLD TV WAS NOTHING LIKE THIS.  THE COLOR AND EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS TV IS WONDERFUL.  THE PRICE COULD NOT BE BEAT ANYWHERE.  I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TV TO ANYONE WHO IS LOOKING FOR A GREAT TV AT A GREAT PRICE.  I COULD NOT FIND ANYTHING TO COMPLAIN ABOUT WITH THIS TV.  I LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture !  Sound, Not So Much!
Reviews.Author: TERRENCE S SCOTT
Reviews.Content: Love the picture quality on this TV.  However sound is tinny and the s[eakers distort very easily.I am getting a high pitch feedback through the speakers at low volumes that is really annoying,  I have ordered a Yamaha Sound bar so I can bypass the installed speakers.Hopefully this will fix the problem.  I will updat my review once I have installed and tested

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Dan Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Yes, I would recommend this product.  It's a good value with an acceptable picture for the price. I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Jensen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 6 months ago and I love it. I was looking for a large LCD TV without the "smart" and 3D features that tend to drive up price. After comparing TVs online and in multiple stores, this TV stood out as the best choice for me in this price category (I paid about $850). In fact, I was a bit shocked to find a name-brand 55" TV for such a reasonable price. The picture is bright, the screen has a glare-reducing finish, and the viewing angle is fantastic. It has 1080P, 120hz and a good number of video processing options. The number of inputs in limited, but no issue for me because I have an AV receiver. The backlit LED makes it a bit thicker than some other TVs, but the tradeoff is that the bezel around the edge is much thinner. The design of the TV is one of the best on the market in my opinion. It mounted easily to the wall (wall mount was sold separately).My only issue is that I am not a fan of the control knob on the TV itself. Rather than traditional single-purpose buttons, Samsung opted for a single button that you can slide left, right, front, back, and down (to click). It is mounted under the bottom left bezel, which is a bit awkward to use considering how my TV is mounted to the wall. I just don't understand the advantage. For example, turning off the TV with the button involves 2 clicks (one to the front to highlight "power off" and another to actually select it). I haven't tried to do other things with the button yet, but I have to imagine it would be frustrating. Luckily, I use the remote to control the TV most of the time so this doesn't bother me enough to reduce the star rating.
